feed.title: Dawarich Releases
feed.subtitle: Self-hosted software releases generated by selfh.st

entry.title: New release for Dawarich: 0.25.4
entry.content:
‚ö†Ô∏è This release includes a breaking change. ‚ö†Ô∏è

Make sure to add dawarich_storage volume and SELF_HOSTED: "true" to your docker-compose.yml file. Example:

```diff ...

dawarich_app: image: freikin/dawarich:latest container_name: dawarich_app volumes: - dawarich_public:/var/app/public - dawarich_watched:/var/app/tmp/imports/watched + - dawarich_storage:/var/app/storage ... environment: + SELF_HOSTED: "true"

...

dawarich_sidekiq: image: freikin/dawarich:latest container_name: dawarich_sidekiq volumes: - dawarich_public:/var/app/public - dawarich_watched:/var/app/tmp/imports/watched + - dawarich_storage:/var/app/storage ... environment: + SELF_HOSTED: "true"

volumes: dawarich_db_data: dawarich_shared: dawarich_public: dawarich_watched: + dawarich_storage: ```

On Unraid, if you're experiencing 401 error, in the console run the following:

ruby User.find_each { _1.update(status: :active, active_until: 100.years.from_now) }

In this release we're changing the way import files are being stored. Previously, they were being stored in the raw_data column of the imports table. Now, they are being attached to the import record. All new imports will be using the new storage, to migrate existing imports, you can use the rake imports:migrate_to_new_storage task. Run it in the container shell.

This is an optional task, that will not affect your points or other data. Big imports might take a while to migrate, so be patient.

Also, you can now migrate existing exports to the new storage using the rake exports:migrate_to_new_storage task (in the container shell) or just delete them.

If your hardware doesn't have enough memory to migrate the imports, you can delete your imports and re-import them.

Added

  • Sentry is now can be used for error tracking.
  • Subscription management is now available in non self-hosted mode.

Changed

  • Import files are now being attached to the import record instead of being stored in the raw_data database column.
  • Import files can now be stored in S3-compatible storage.
  • Export files are now being attached to the export record instead of being stored in the file system.
  • Export files can now be stored in S3-compatible storage.
  • Users can now import Google's Records.json file via the UI instead of using the CLI.
  • Optional telemetry sending is now disabled and will be removed in the future.

Fixed

  • Moving points on the map now works correctly. #957
  • rake points:migrate_to_lonlat task now also reindexes the points table.
  • Fixed filling lonlat column for old places after reverse geocoding.
  • Deleting an import now correctly recalculates stats.
  • Datetime across the app is now being displayed in human readable format, i.e 26 Dec 2024, 13:49. Hover over the datetime to see the ISO 8601 timestamp.

üíô This release is supported by Steven B., James Manolios, chenrik, aldumil, derpderpington, Chippie, dint, jhalpern, Lex Fradski, Schlufo, cyberswan.at, craftyklaus, JMyrng, Andre, hogenf, naraxius, Lemur, Embrace, martin4861 and Jonah B. on Patreon üíô

What's Changed

  • Feature/bucket import export by @Freika in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/980
  • Feature/records web import by @Freika in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/1007
  • Feature/records web import by @Freika in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/1008
  • Feature/active until by @Freika in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/1009
  • Feature/subscription by @Freika in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/1010
  • 0.25.4 by @Freika in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/1001

Full Changelog: https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/compare/0.25.3...0.25.4

entry.title: New release for Dawarich: 0.25.5
entry.content:
This release introduces a new way to send transactional emails using SMTP. Example may include password reset, email confirmation, etc.

To enable SMTP mailing, you need to set the following environment variables:

  • SMTP_SERVER - SMTP server address.
  • SMTP_PORT - SMTP server port.
  • SMTP_DOMAIN - SMTP server domain.
  • SMTP_USERNAME - SMTP server username.
  • SMTP_PASSWORD - SMTP server password.
  • SMTP_FROM - Email address to send emails from.

This is an optional feature and is not required for the app to work.

Removed

  • Optional telemetry was removed from the app. The ENABLE_TELEMETRY env var can be safely removed from docker compose.

Changed

  • rake points:migrate_to_lonlat task now also tries to extract latitude and longitude from raw_data column before using longitude and latitude columns to fill lonlat column.
  • Docker entrypoints are now using DATABASE_NAME environment variable to check if Postgres is existing/available.
  • Sidekiq web UI is now protected by basic auth. Use SIDEKIQ_USERNAME and SIDEKIQ_PASSWORD environment variables to set the credentials.

Added

  • You can now provide SMTP settings in ENV vars to send emails.
  • You can now edit imports. #1044 #623

Fixed

  • Importing data from Immich now works correctly. #1019

üíô This release is supported by Steven B., James Manolios, chenrik, aldumil, derpderpington, Chippie, dint, jhalpern, Lex Fradski, Schlufo, cyberswan.at, craftyklaus, JMyrng, Andre, hogenf, naraxius, Lemur, Embrace, martin4861, Alex and Jonah B. on Patreon üíô

What's Changed

  • Dev by @Freika in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/1030
  • Update CHANGELOG.md by @Freika in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/1031
  • Chore/cleanup and telemetry removal by @Freika in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/1054
  • Bump rubocop-rails from 2.30.1 to 2.31.0 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/1026
  • Bump redis from 5.3.0 to 5.4.0 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/937
  • Bump chartkick from 5.1.3 to 5.1.4 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/936
  • Bump pundit from 2.4.0 to 2.5.0 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/935
  • Feature/smtp mailing by @Freika in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/1063
  • Editing imports by @Freika in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/1074
  • 0.25.5 by @Freika in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/1075

Full Changelog: https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/compare/0.25.4...0.25.5

entry.title: New release for Dawarich: 0.25.6
entry.content:
Added

  • In the map settings (top left corner of the map), you can now select colors for your colored routes. #682

Changed

  • Import edit page now allows to edit import name.
  • Importing data now does not create a notification for the user.
  • Updating stats now does not create a notification for the user.

Fixed

  • Fixed a bug where an import was failing due to partial file download. #1069 #1073 #1024 #1051

üíô This release is supported by Steven B., James Manolios, chenrik, aldumil, derpderpington, Chippie, dint, jhalpern, Lex Fradski, Schlufo, cyberswan.at, craftyklaus, JMyrng, Andre, hogenf, naraxius, Lemur, Embrace, martin4861, Alex, evetters and Jonah B. on Patreon üíô

What's Changed

  • Bump pry-byebug from 3.10.1 to 3.11.0 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/1056
  • Release/0 25 6 by @Freika in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/1091
  • Bump httparty from 0.22.0 to 0.23.1 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/1086
  • Add speed color scale setting by @MeijiRestored in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/1020
  • Bump sidekiq-cron from 2.1.0 to 2.2.0 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/1085
  • Bump rexml from 3.4.0 to 3.4.1 by @dependabot in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/1084
  • 0.25.6 by @Freika in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/1092

New Contributors

  • @MeijiRestored made their first contribution in https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/pull/1020

Full Changelog: https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/compare/0.25.5...0.25.6

entry.title: New release for Dawarich: 0.25.8
entry.content:
Fixed

  • Database was not being created if it didn't exist. #1076

Removed

  • RAILS_MASTER_KEY environment variable is no longer being set. You can safely remove it from your environment variables.

üíô This release is supported by Steven B., James Manolios, chenrik, aldumil, derpderpington, Chippie, dint, jhalpern, Lex Fradski, Schlufo, cyberswan.at, craftyklaus, JMyrng, Andre, hogenf, naraxius, Lemur, Embrace, martin4861, Alex, evetters and Jonah B. on Patreon üíô

Full Changelog: https://github.com/Freika/dawarich/compare/0.25.7...0.25.8
